contextId.occurrenceNote: This likely refers to the leaders of the army. Alternate translation: "The officers of the army" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])

Here "heart" refers to the king, and "feeling happy" is an idiom that means he was drunk. Alternate translation: "the king was drunk with wine" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: the king's heart was feeling happy because of the wine

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "hands" stands for the men. To "weigh out" is an idiom that means to pay them. Alternate translation: "I will pay ... to the men" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: I will weigh out ... into the hands of those

contextId.occurrenceNote: This represents all that Haman had owned. Alternate translation: "all that had belonged to Haman" or "all of Haman's property" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
